intro: Racosperma alcockii, commonly known as the Alcock's acacia, is a shrub native to northern Australia. It is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Racosperma alcockii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions. It is often found in sandy soils and is a component of the local flora in the Northern Territory.
